derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English smītan 'to smear, blemish', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch smijten and German schmeissen 'to fling'

entry.def: To smite something means to hit it hard.

example.ex: ...the heroic leader charging into battle, sword held high, ready to smite the enemy.
